text: I'm Matt gross the frugal traveler for
the new york times this summer I'm
embarking on the grand tour of Europe
over 12 weeks I'll seek out ancient
history and contemporary culture I'll
find cool hotels and eat memorable meals
and I'll stretch the US dollar to the
breaking point finally I was going to
Monaco the place to be when you've got
sports cars to drive money to burn or a
yacht to sail as usual I had none of the
above but I did have a nice affordable
hotel via zoo the room itself wasn't
much but it did have a lovely balcony
and I had high hopes for Monaco hopes
that were soon dashed by an unexpected
fo the rain yes it was gray wet and far
from sexy in Monaco and of course as
soon as I left the weather brightened
right up anyway I was going to Montel
the last town in France before you reach
Italy several readers had recommended

Texas which was actually named from
